display_long_description:
'A Frozen Night' transports you into the past and deep into the Antarctic circle. 

Brought to you by UK Antarctic Heritage Trust, 'A Frozen Night' brings to life a captivating true short story from 1965, Antarctica, as in interactive narrative. Hear first-hand from those who called Antarctica ‘home’ and come face to face with the risks of Antarctic fieldwork.

Suitable for new and seasoned VR users, 'A Frozen Night' will transport you to the last great wilderness.

UKAHT is a charity dedicated to preserving British Antarctic history and inspiring people to connect with, and protect, this remarkable continent. As a charity, we rely on public donations to fund vital conservation work in Antarctica and deliver ambitious and innovative public engagement programmes. 

Find out how to support our upcoming projects and join us as we work to protect Antarctica’s human history at www.ukaht.org

This project was made possible through collaboration with the British Antarctic Survey Archive team and with colleagues at StoryLab, Anglia Ruskin University, to bring the concept to life.

Story length approximately 20-30mins.
